about_the_game:
The Keio 3000 series was a DC electric multiple unit (EMU) train type operated by Keio Corporation on the Keio Inokashira Line in Japan from 1962 until 2011. The 3000 series was the first Keio rolling stock to use completely stainless-steel body construction.

The first train began commercial operation on December 28, 1962. The door is a 1,200 mm single-sided door, the power generation braking, forced ventilation resistors, window splits, etc. are the same as those of the old 1000 series, and the body width is 2,700 mm, which is narrower than the subsequent train. It appeared in a 4-car train with an MT ratio of 2M2T. The narrow body type was the 1st and 2nd train set. Later 3rd sets above were built with a wider body of 100mm.


The two early narrow-body 3000 series sets were resold to the Hokuriku Railroad in Kanazawa, Ishikawa, where they became two-car 8800 series sets 8801 to 8802.

Package Includes:

*Keio 3000 Series Narrow Body (3700 series), 6 cars total. 2 combined 4 cars trainsets of different liveries.
*Asanogawa Railway 8800 Series, 6 cars total. 3 combined 2 cars trainsets of different liveries.

Features:
*Realistic exterior and cab with full, detailed High-Resolution PBR textures
*Realistic electromagnetic direct brake braking system, commonly used at Japanese EMU.
*Animated passenger doors
*Animated wipers
*Animated pantograph
*JR-ATS (Automatic Train Stop) security equipment with sound fx
*Night mode
*Dedicated cab with full functional EMU Controller includes:
*Functional master controller and switches
*All indicator gauges are working
*"one-man" service compatibility (open/close all passenger doors in set via cab button) + door closing indicator confirmation

Sound fx include:
*Custom train brake sound
*Door opening/closing sound
*Custom brake compressor sound
*Train starting sfx sound
*Realistic custom driving and rail joint sound
detailed_description:
The Keio 3000 series was a DC electric multiple unit (EMU) train type operated by Keio Corporation on the Keio Inokashira Line in Japan from 1962 until 2011. The 3000 series was the first Keio rolling stock to use completely stainless-steel body construction.

The first train began commercial operation on December 28, 1962. The door is a 1,200 mm single-sided door, the power generation braking, forced ventilation resistors, window splits, etc. are the same as those of the old 1000 series, and the body width is 2,700 mm, which is narrower than the subsequent train. It appeared in a 4-car train with an MT ratio of 2M2T. The narrow body type was the 1st and 2nd train set. Later 3rd sets above were built with a wider body of 100mm.


The two early narrow-body 3000 series sets were resold to the Hokuriku Railroad in Kanazawa, Ishikawa, where they became two-car 8800 series sets 8801 to 8802.

Package Includes:

*Keio 3000 Series Narrow Body (3700 series), 6 cars total. 2 combined 4 cars trainsets of different liveries.
*Asanogawa Railway 8800 Series, 6 cars total. 3 combined 2 cars trainsets of different liveries.

Features:
*Realistic exterior and cab with full, detailed High-Resolution PBR textures
*Realistic electromagnetic direct brake braking system, commonly used at Japanese EMU.
*Animated passenger doors
*Animated wipers
*Animated pantograph
*JR-ATS (Automatic Train Stop) security equipment with sound fx
*Night mode
*Dedicated cab with full functional EMU Controller includes:
*Functional master controller and switches
*All indicator gauges are working
*"one-man" service compatibility (open/close all passenger doors in set via cab button) + door closing indicator confirmation

Sound fx include:
*Custom train brake sound
*Door opening/closing sound
*Custom brake compressor sound
*Train starting sfx sound
*Realistic custom driving and rail joint sound

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 11.6
  • Processor: Intel i5 2Ghz
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon Pro 555 with 1GB VRAM supporting OpenGL 3.3
  • Storage: 510 MB available space

short_description: The Keio 3000 series was a DC electric multiple unit (EMU) train type operated by Keio Corporation on the Keio Inokashira Line in Japan from 1962 until 2011. This pack features the Keio 3000 Series Narrow Body 4 car sets and Asanogawa Railway 8800 Series 2 car sets.
supported_languages: English, Italian, Spanish - Spain, Czech, Dutch, Polish, Russian, French, German
